title: JSON schema for Elastic Common Schema field definitions.

name.title: name
name.description: Name of the field set, lowercased and with underscores to separate words.

title.title: title
title.description: Capitalized name of the field set with spaces to separate words. For use in documentation section titles.

description.title: description
description.description: Description of the field set. Two subsequent newlines create a new paragraph.

fields.title: fields
fields.description: An array of objects defining the individual fields in the field set.

level.title: fields.$field.level
level.description: One of: core, extended. ECS level of maturity of the field.

short.title: fields.$field.short
short.description: Short version of the description to display in small spaces.

example.title: fields.$field.example
example.description: A single value example of what can be expected in this field.

multi_fields.title: fields.$field.multi_field
multi_fields.description: Define additional data types this field will also index.

index.title: fields.$field.index
index.description: If `False`, means field is not indexed.

format.title: fields.$field.format
format.description: Field format that can be used in a Kibana index template.

normalize.title: fields.$field.normalize
normalize.description: Normalization steps that should be applied at ingestion time.

beta.title: fields.$field.beta
beta.description: Adds a beta marker for the field to the field's description. The text provided in this attribute is used as content of the beta marker in the documentation.

short.title: short
short.description: Short version of the description to display in small spaces, such as the list of field sets. Short descriptions must not have newlines. Defaults to the main description when absent. If hte main description has multiple paragraphs, then a `short` description with no newlines is required.

root.title: root
root.description: Whether or not the fields of this field should be namespaced under the field set name.

group.title: group
group.description: To sort field sets against one another. For example, the 'base' field set has a group=1 and is the first listed in the document. All others have group=2 and are therefore after the 'base' (sorted alphabetically).

type.title: type
type.description: At this level, should always be `group`.

reusable.title: reusable
reusable.description: Used to identify which field sets are expected to be reused in multiple places. See 'Field set reuse' for details.

expected.title: reusable.expected
expected.description: List of places the field set's fields are expected. There are two valid notations to list expected locations.

at.title: reusable.expected.at
at.description: The location where the field set will be reused at.

as.title: reusable.expected.as
as.description: The name of the field set where it's reused.

beta.title: reusable.expected.title
beta.description: If the field reuse is considered beta, provides a hover tooltip text for the docs.

short_override.title: reusable.expected.short_override
short_override.description: Set the short description of the nested field, instead of defaulting to the top-level field set's short description.

top_level.title: reusable.top_level
top_level.description: Is this field set expected at the root of events or is it only expected in the nested locations?

short_override.title: short_override
short_override.description: Used to override the top-level field set's short description when nesting.

beta.title: beta
beta.description: Adds a beta marker for the entire field set. The text provided in this attribute is used as content of the beta marker in the documentation. Beta notices should not have newlines.
